channel.title: Access Modifiers :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Access Modifiers C# provides 4 access modifiers for classes, fields, etc.: public, internal, protected, and private. For simplicity, however, we will not allow the use of the internal or protected access modifiers unless they are required by the compiler (for example, when overriding a protected method). When classes, fields, etc., are declared, C# does not require that an access modifier be used. If the access modifier is omitted, a default accessibility level will be used.
